shortdesc.i: This event is fired by the system. If you want to listen to the event you can do so using the document.addEventListener function and remove the listener using the document.removeEventListener function. The perimeterlocked event is triggered whenever the corporate or enterprise application is locked. Note: This event is not fired for non-corporate apps.

dd.p: The callback function that will be triggered on the perimeterlocked event.

p.pre:
<script type="text/javascript">

function onPerimeterLocked() {
    alert("The corporate app is locked!");
}

document.addEventListener("perimeterlocked", onPerimeterLocked);
</script>
